active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the effectiveness of container image provenance tracking (e.g., SLSA + Cosign) versus traditional checksums or signatures in preventing real-world supply chain attacks like XZ Utils. What are the trade-offs in terms of complexity, adoption, and false positives? Support your arguments with examples from container ecosystems.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Container Image Security. Topic: Image Provenance Tracking (Level 6 in hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > Software Development Ecosystems > 008_Container and Orchestration Security > 002_Container Image Security > Image Provenance Tracking). Focus exclusively on container/OCI/Docker images, NOT digital media (ignore C2PA; use SLSA, Sigstore Cosign, in-toto, Notation, SBOM, OCI artifacts). Incorporate real-world examples: SolarWinds, XZ Utils backdoors. Use these LEARNING OBJECTIVES [insert full list above]. Structure content via SCAFFOLDING LAYERS [insert full list above]. Include ACTIVE LEARNING elements in explanations for context. Generate 40-60 high-quality flashcards following FLASHCARD SCHEMA [insert full schema above]. Ensure: - Balance: Bloom's levels, scaffolding layers. - Distractors: Follow protocol precisely. - Pedagogy: Active recall, spaced repetition friendly; explanations scaffold from foundation to integration, link to prerequisites (PKI, containers). - Accuracy: Web-grounded (Sigstore docs, SLSA spec, Cosign GitHub, OCI standards RFC 8949). Output as JSON array: [{'id':1, 'type':'MCQ', 'front':'...', 'back':{'answer':'...', 'explanation':'...', 'bloom_level':'...', 'layer':1, 'prerequisites':[]}}, ...]. No extra text.
